newsitem.title: JAPAN: NEC, Sumitomo to form fund for U.S. venture firms.
newsitem.headline: NEC, Sumitomo to form fund for U.S. venture firms.

text.p: NEC Corp and Sumitomo Bank Ltd said on Monday that they would form a $60 million partnership fund to be used for investment in U.S. venture capital companies, particularly in Silicon Valley, in such fields as telecommunications, computers and multimedia.

The fund, to be formed on Wednesday, will be 74.25 percent invested by NEC through its U.S. unit, 24.75 percent invested by Sumitomo and one percent by Convergence Partners LP, to be formed to manage the fund, they said in a joint statement.
Convergence will establish relationships with high technology entrepreneurial ventures, providing strategic counsel, the statement said.
NEC's unit, NEC USA Inc, will also establish a venture liaison organisation in Silicon Valley to assist and enable young and upcoming companies to have more appropriate access to NEC, it said.
